name: node-boilerplate-cli
description: An CLI to generate modern boilerplate skeleton for node and browser modules.
author: Mauro Junior <mauropereirajr@gmail.com>

scripts.start: if-env NODE_ENV=production && npm run start:prod || npm run start:dev
scripts.?start:prod: Startup the module with a `production` environment.
scripts.?start:dev: Startup the module with a `development` environment.
scripts.?debug: Start a debugger for the `main` entry point.
scripts.?debug:tests: Start a debugger for the tests
scripts.?commit: Run a wizard to do a `git commit` following commitizen rules.
scripts.?commit:all: Add all changes to stage and commit...
scripts.test: npm run lint && nyc --check-coverage mocha --compilers js:babel-register ./test/*.js
scripts.?test:watch: Build, run all tests and watch for changes.
scripts.?lint:watch: Run Eslint, and watch for chhanges.
scripts.?coverage:summary: Show a coverage summary in the console.
scripts.?build: Check types and build the source to the `lib` folder.
scripts.?setup: Install dependencies and run the tests.
scripts.?semantic-release: Automatically publish the package following semantic versioning rules.
scripts.semantic-release: semantic-release pre && npm publish && semantic-release post
